Reviews.Title: “Deserving”
Reviews.Author: Babym00n
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my family for an overnight stay and was enough to understand everything about it. It'ss placed in a really nice location,"San Lorenzo",a very eventful district quite close to the city centre,as well. The staff is warm ( i really appreciated the kindness of the receptionist),the rooms are surprisingly clean (in the bathroom you could walk with bare feet ,i swear) and spacious as well. There's free wifi (you have just to enter their code on your laptop),the breakfast is included ( there's lot of stuff: pies,cakes,fruit juice,biscuits,ham...) and the price is sooo cheap: we paid around 40 euros (33 pounds) per person. There's also an excellent restaurant called "I Fratelli" just after the first side street. Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, clean property with pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: BGWestVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our group of 30 - school trip consisting of high school students, teachers, parents and grandparents stayed five nights at Hotel Laurentia. As another reviewer noted the location is somewhat "gloomy" but the accessibility to Termini and nearby cafes was very nice. Our lodging consisted of a large bedroom, large bathroom and hallway with chair and coat rack - my husband, son and I were very satisfied with the accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: briand06
Reviews.Content: Small hotel conveniently located in San Lorenzo, in the immediate surroundings of the main railway station and the university. Nice staff. Very good price and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Good location”
Reviews.Author: Travelite1969
Reviews.Content: In my frequent visits to Rome , I have stayed at this small hotel quite few time. The hotel is conveniently located in San Lorenzo very easy to reach from the rail stations either Termini Station or Tiburtina Station never more than 7€ Euro of a taxi ride. It is great if you have to attend or you have some business at local La Sapienza University ( like in my case) 5 min. walk. Rooms tough a bit dated are clean and comfortable. Free wi-fi connection everywhere. Great continental breakfast. At night many good options for local dining from very simple pizza places to restaurants and pubs where to grab a drink . For those who like to visit town tough not right in the city center it is very easy to reach main sites by bus number 492 and 71 ...just from the main road behind the hotel. The reception staff is very professional and accommodating I had to shorten my stay in two different occasion and they never charged me a penalty for doing so. They help ed me with taxi arrangements and left luggages. Rates if you book well in advance are really great for a town like Rome. Definitely a place to stay in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “We like it and we'll be back to Laurentia!”
Reviews.Author: Vsevolod K
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast, clean and spacious rooms, location is nice but to far to walk on foot to the historical center of Rome

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & don't recommend it at all !”
Reviews.Author: Damdoom81
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel only because it was close to the Termini metro station .. Which was right, it's only 15-20 minutes walk .. But we weren't aware that the roads would be this horrible, & we'd be climbing some sort of a hill to reach there! The room was big yes, but it had no AC, & the weather was very hot during our stay, so you can imagine the horrible sleep we had! Also, the furniture is very old & the lighting is bad! Plus, it was a very noisy street, you hear people laughing & shouting until 3 or 4 am! The bathroom was very small, although there was hot water all the time .. Breakfast was okay, but we had the same menu everyday! I don't really recommend this hotel, although it's a 3star hotel! You can find other better hotels in other areas of Rome with the same price ..

Reviews.Title: “We can only recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ptallai
Reviews.Content: This is a really good one if you're searching for a good hotel with a good price! The hotel "crew" is friendly and helpful, they mostly speak English. It's actually a bit far away from everything if you're not using a car or scooter. So if you don't prefer walking and you would like to discover Rome just on foot, you should rent something in the middle of the city. The breakfast is OK, the hotel is surrounded by lots of restaurants, shops and there's even a market... so you can by whatever you need. Overall this is a really good place to stay, if you're on a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DannyMack
Reviews.Content: The standard of service form the hotel is excellent and the staff are very friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the street outside our window was at times quite noisy. However in a busy city this has to be expected. I will definitely check price and availability the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly Hotel - very nice crew in a lifley and trendy quarter”
Reviews.Author: parkseite
Reviews.Content: We asked for a romantic room upstairs with a nice view - and alberto, the very helkpfuly and friendly manager, has given us a great room with a wonderful view on the square with the market and church and his tower - we even could see the hill and mountains! Room was very cosey - little but not too little, beds are really nice, all clean, italian styled. Breakfast room in a cave very speciall and we had good fresh made coffee there. Location is great if you like to stay in a trendy and alteritave lifely aera with great bars, restaurants, small fashion and vintage store, lots of life music and art - not the overpriced and overrated touristic zone of rome, more the real rome - but also very close to Coloseum and termini - for those who are lazy - they can catch bus 71 or 492 nearby to vatican or plaza spagna, nr. 3 to colosseum - coming from the airport fiumcino its better to go with train FR 1 to Tiburtina Station and then taking the bus outside Nr.71 directly to Porto San Lorenzo (8 minutes). Theres a great enotecca leftside from hotel with antipasti buffet and great wine and also a super pizza to go place right from the hotel as well as the small market offers fresh fruits and cheese and more! At night, theres lots of people making it a reall scenic square. But - windows closing well, so it never is too loud if you wanna sleep well - we highly recommend the hotel and his friendly staff and the aera for those who are not to stiff and looking for something real in rome. (PS: Check out the micca club through the passage in via micca pietro) a great lounge and cocktail retro club!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE...WORST HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aline2004
Reviews.Content: Terrible place to stay doesn't matter if you 're on budget or not.they just don't like tourists the staff was very rude and unfriendlly.I went with my husband and parents we got there 10pm in a hot day ,one of the bedroons the AC wasn't working the recepcionist told us that we should sleep and He would call someone to fix the next day.we changed rooms.but all looks the same dirty,the elevator isdisgusting.The breakfast don't even bother with...really bad...worst juice ever.Also is far ...really far from main sightseens in Rome...and the area It's a "student area",loud...I would say not the best area to stay in Rome.Overall I liked Rome but the hotel never ever will see me again....please DON"T STAY THERE...and enjoy ROME it's fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Sarita72
Reviews.Content: We stopped in Rome for our last three days of our honeymoon. We dont have much money, and thought that 75EUR for a room with a balcony in Rome would be a great deal! Well, there were 36c and had to use the aircon. Only problem is that it started to leak quite badly and flooded the floor!!! This was 2am, we asked if there was something that they could do, reply 'Sorry not till tomorrow morning'. We didnt sleep much. Morning after, they downgraded us to a small room on 3rd floor, facing the square again. It was supposed to be a double but was in fact a twin with beds pushed together, not what you want on your honeymoon! Also, hotel has no iron, something that we thought it was unheard of! I agree with all those that have said towels were rubbish (I even tore one apart as I was drying my hair with it!!!), place is dirty and staff unfriendly except for one or two guys at reception. At breakfast we were shouted at by a woman who said '5 minutes', not even 'Excuse me please ,you have got 5 minutes to finish your breakfast'. Then, on both mornings, we had cleaning staff walking into our room!!!!! Terrible place, area isnt too bad, can look scary for someone not used to Italian lefty kind of feeling, but we walked to hotel both nights at 4am and felt relatively safe. I wouldnt go there, and i would agree with those who have said to stay at a more expensive hostel, then at last you know what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: UkGuestUK
Reviews.Content: What a disappointing experience! (to say the least). The hotel is not close to the city centre and a good 30 mints walk from the main entrance of the train station, too long if you are pulling suitcases. The area is very uninviting and a bit scary at night. We arrived at the reception desk to find the receptionist sitting behind a computer and we couldn’t help but notice a wet stain down his pants, which I believe might have something to do with whatever he was doing at the computer, what a horrific first impression. It only went downhill from then, the bedroom was very dusty and the tiles in the bathroom where cracked and dirty. There were hairs on the bed and the towels were of very cheap quality. Don't get me started on breakfast; stale break, no ham or cheese, just butter and jam and very rude staff.To be honest if you are travelling to Italy on a budget, you should either avoid Rome or stay at a trendy hostel. I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Fair City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fussel2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to the University which means that there are several bars and restaurants close by. It's a walk of approx. 15 minutes to the main station 'termini'. From there you have a couple of options to reach the sights. The hotel room was medium sized but clean, the restroom could have been larger. The continental breakfast which was served was fine.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tufanica
Reviews.Content: It is quiet and clean hotel located in the student neighborhood near the Termini - district not very clean. The hotel staff is of note 10. Near the hotel is a supermarket with low prices. Breakfast is not very diversified and repeat every day. Cold Buffet: yogurt, milk, tea, coffee, croissants, pies, butter, jam, cereal, without cheese or salami. From the hotel to get to almost all major sights by bus 492. The hotel was ok for price paid: 65 EUR / double room. I return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A cheap hotel perfect for the right travellers”
Reviews.Author: Tania49
Reviews.Content: The street the hotel is situated in is scruffy and absolutely full of graffiti. Yet behind many of those doors are excellent reasonably priced restaurants, -- don't be put off by the outside appearances. We stayed for nine nights and the six of us ate extremely well and didn't have one poor meal. The hotel is cheap, clean and desk staff are very helpful and friendly .. As previous reviewers have commented water pressure is poor and the temperature even worse! -- no power showers at the Laurentia ! Breakfasts are adequate. The thing to note perhaps is that there is no kitchen at the hotel -- Coffe comes from a machine and you cannot purchase food at the hotel but there are bakeries and pizzerias a few doors away from the hotel. For those on a tight budget there is a well stocked supermarket a few hundred metres away from the hotel -- turn left as you go out of the hotel walk 150 m and it's across the road. Directly opposite the hotel is a small market. which sells mainly food. The hotel is based in the University district of Rome. The area is lively and noisy and some distance from the tourist sites.If you are confident to catch public transport and push your way on to the overcrowded buses or walk to theTermini (Central trains and/bus station in Rome) which is approximately 20 minutes away then the hotel is a good cheap option. If you are not prepared to do this then choose a more centrally located hotel. Also, if you expect to use the Internet frequently then you might have to wait because there is only computer access -- but who wants to spend their time e-mailing in Rome.?

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: sparklar
Reviews.Content: had a conference at the university so it was a perfect location for that. the hotel itself is very nice...good room, great breakfast, and extremely friendly guys at the front desk who were very helpful with everything. would be nice to have wifi in all the rooms, but was still ok using it in the lobby. the area is young with lots of students and there are some great bars around.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good service, realy italian non touristic neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: castroholland
Reviews.Content: We spend 7 nights in this hotel. We paid 55 euro a night (offer). After we've booked the hotel we saw that the prices ran up to 126 euro's a night. Thats a bit too much for this hotel by the way. The hotel is very clean, breakfast is good, service very good (we had a good laugh with Alberto, the receptionist!). The Russian or polish girls who are serving breakfast are not so friendly by the way. The area is italian and we liked it! Students, alternative people and Roman families in the bars and restaurants. No or very few tourists! Transport with bus 71 or 492 to the hart of Rome is excellent. Two restaurants we like to recomend: Osteria/Winebar/Pizzeria Sanlollo (via dei Sabelli 51)and ristorante Da Pino (real Roman cuisine!), via Tiburtina Antica 4/6). The gelateria's at via Tiburtina also nice to spend a visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nimontroy
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly and helpful, speaking English well. Room was clean and large. Double bed and two single beds. Initially we were a bit daunted by location but found and had not problems. Location was close to main rail station, restaurants, etc. Breakfast was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: tlc_too
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 2008. Rooms are small but clean and comfortable and very reasonably priced. The hotel itself is on a quiet street but just a short walk to restaurants, grocery stores and public transport. Your first impression of the neighbourhood may not be great but it is deceiving. If you look past all the graffiti and the garbage bins on the side of the street it really isn't that bad! We walked everywhere day and night and did not feel unsafe at any time. The Termini train station is about a 10 minute walk away along a 3rd Century BC wall - you don't get that every day! From the Termini you can easily get on the Metro or a bus and make it to almost anywhere in the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but a bit Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: fsdiss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2000 and loved it. Close to Termini Station, good restaurants close by and the hotel itself is charming, from the attentive people at the front desk to the beautiful breakfast room. I was disappointed in how the area around the hotel has deteriorated - tagging everywhere - not kept up at all. While we didn't feel threatened at all, I would not recommend single women to walk around the area at night.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay - We liked the area”
Reviews.Author: ennove29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Laurentia for one night in October 2006 -- we were booked at a nearby property for the rest of our stay, but as they were full the first night, they recommended the Laurentia. Overall, it was a decent stay. We were in room 14 (I think that was the number, anyway) on the first floor behind the breakfast area. It was a little noisy, and I think not their nicest room, which was understandable as this was really a last minute booking. When entering our room, there was a tiny hallway with our private bath on the left and a very small bedroom ahead. The bedroom was a little worn, and the bed was typical for Europe -- too hard for our tastes. It was extremely clean and well maintained, however. The bathroom was reasonably large with a separate toilet / bidet area. The towels were the thin waffle type, but generously sized. The shower was a bit of a problem. It was a step down from the main bathroom area, as it was located under a stairway. The shower doors did not fully enclose the shower area so it was impossible to keep water from going everywhere. This was causing tile deterioration and a musty smell in the bathroom, although it was still very clean - I can't imagine the amount of scrubbing that had to be going on to keep the mildew under control. The staff was English speaking and helpful. When specifically asked, they would provide a great Rome map (don't bother buying one) and give recommendations and directions on anything in Rome. They were typically Italian, being courteous by not getting in your way (like the waiters not wanting to bring your check) so you do have to ask them directly for help. It was nice having a full time desk clerk there, as we stayed out late. I must respectfully disagree with some other reviews on the area being "unsafe". There was a lot of graffiti -- it's a huge problem all over Rome -- but we never felt the area was remotely unsafe. Italian women were out alone late in the area (no, not that kind of woman either) and things stayed busy till after midnight. It was a vibrant, authentic, and fascinating university area - think East Village NYC, or any urban college community. It was actually a relief to get away from the central historic area in the evenings, which started to feel like Universal Studios Roma after a while. The food was more authentic and cheaper here too. While the staff in the stores and restaurants spoke a little less English here than in the touristy sections, almost everybody spoke some English and were very encouraging and helpful when we tried out our phrasebook Italian. The drawback to the area was transportation. While it was not exactly remote, it was a 30 minute direct bus ride to the Trevi Fountain / Spanish Steps area (bus 71), a 30 minute direct tram ride to the Colosseum (tram 3), and a 1 hour direct but very windy bus ride to the Vatican. You could also connect to the rather limited subway system via bus 71. The buses could be pretty difficult to navigate, too. I think if you are the type of person who likes to go back to the hotel a lot during the day, you should fork out the extra money for a very centrally located hotel. Otherwise, seize this (or similar) opportunities to experience a more authentic side of Rome, and take daily field trips into the historic centre. Overall, not a bad stay. Search the area to see if you can get a better deal, but there's no reason to stay away from the Laurentia.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay in the Laurentia”
Reviews.Author: Chocolatechick24
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Laurentia for 3 nights in August 2004 and found it great value for money - although the rates seem to have hiked up since then (I paid 60 euros per night for a double room). The walk to the main station is only about 10 minutes and there are busses from very nearby the hotel if you don't want to walk far. The room we stayed in was very small but more than adequate as we didn't spend much time in the hotel. There was a good range of choice for breakfast at the hotel, cereals, nuts, fruit and different breads. I found the hotel staff very helpful and friendly. They recommended some good restaurants in the area. I argee with the other reviewers view of Armandos, it was lovely - and inexpensive. Economica pizzeria was also very good. I did not feel the area of the hotel was unsafe and liked that it was in a bit of a quieter area. Overall I think the hotel provided good value for money - but as I said it now seems to be more expensive so this may not be the case anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Pay the Extra for a Terrace Room!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Laurentia can't do enough to help you enjoy your stay. From booking taxis, to recommending local restaurants for both lunch and dinner, to translation. We paid 10 euros extra per night to stay in one of the three terrace rooms on the top floor. This gave us a large balcony with excellent views of the church square & table and chairs to enjoy a drink in the evening. Although the room was basic, it was clean & functional. The shower cubicle is a little small and the towels are more like serviettes but this wasn't a big problem. The hotel bar appears to be open 24 hours a day. Trasport links to all the attractions are fantastic, although we were there for three days and only sussed it all out properly on the last day. You can get 3 tickets for the bus and the metro. The 75-minute ticket allows you one metro journey and unlimited bus journeys for 1 Euro. the day ticket (4 Euros) and the 3-day ticket (11 euros) gives to unlimited access to all forms of public transport until midnight each day (when the night service runs). Make sure you buy a travel guide before you go with the metro and bus routes in it as this will make things a lot easier for you. Our favourite restaurant, which was a stone's throw from the hotel was Armando's, serving excellent Trattoria food, including excellent seafood, and an amazing selection of wines, prosecco and limoncello. We recommend the prosciutto and mozzarella and the seafood mixed grill. Top Tip: If you get lost in Rome, head for the Piazza Venezia as this is where all the buses go from.

Reviews.Title: “Laurentia okay, area not so great, taxis dishonest”
Reviews.Author: Chilliwack70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one week. Our room was quiet, but our friends were disturbed by loud drunks at night. It is close to the University so there are a lot of students out celebrating. Staff very friendly and all except one were very helpful. Area is a little rough but hotel was great value for the money. Clean and a very good breakfast. Watch out for taxis called by the hotel. There are no taxis roaming in this area. Check the meter as soon as you get in the car. One charged us from the time the hotel called him until he arrived at the hotel to pick us up! Over 7 euros before we even started. We didn't get any support from the clerk on duty when we exited the vehicle and compained at the desk. He tried to tell us that it was the way it was done in Rome (even though we had called a taxi in the morning and they didn't do this). Unfortunately we couldn't get another taxi (somehow they were all busy) and had to pay his inflated rate. Also check the meter just before you get to your destination. Even though we had obtained a quote from the driver prior to entering the car, when we reached our restaurant etc. they would push another button and the rate would mysteriously double!. We had many an argument with the drivers over this. We had been warned of this by a car rental owner. He told us to tell the driver that we were going to report him to the Taxation Police and to make sure that we got a receipt from him. This is usually enough to make them honest.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell in room, unsafe location and very noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after we found we'd been moved from our original booking at the Ateneo Garden Palace to the Laurentia; so much for making a credit card reservation - it didn't seem to mean much to the management even though we phoned earlier that day to confirm that we were going to arrive late. When we arrived at the Laurentia there were a lot of drunks on the streets outside and my friend had a glass bottle thown in her direction which smashed and sprayed glass over her and my car - not a good start!! When we got to our room its bathroom smelt strongly of stagnant water and had cracked tiles round the shower and toilet. Although the room itself seemed clean it was impossible to ignore the smell from the bathroom and the carpet was starting to wear through. Outside the noise from the locals continued until approx 4am so we didn't get much sleep. We left the next day to find another hotel. Overall, very poor. Both on the state of this hotel and for the Ateneo Garden Palace for not honouring our original booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great value !!”
Reviews.Author: JPCS
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and enjoyed it tremendously, we went to Rome to see the sights not to hang around the hotel, and for a place to sleep and eat breakfast, the Laurentia is ideal. The staff is very friendly and helpful. If you want a five star or you are scared of local people and restaurants go somewhere else. If you enjoy local cuisine(Great eateries close by), and want to explore Rome, with a clean air-conditioned room to come back to every evening, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe Area”
Reviews.Author: BeccaBelle
Reviews.Content: The area around this hotel is really not safe after dark, which is when we arrived to stay for one night. We were on the first floor (which was ground-level) and I was very uneasy. We were leaving for the airport at 4:00 a.m. and there were some unsavory-looking characters hanging around outside. Women especially should be warned about traveling outside unescorted. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Rome !”
Reviews.Author: alanpat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend break in Rome staying at Hotel Laurentia. + Points on Hotel Rooms and Hotel is very clean, Beds are comfy, Breakfast is fine, Staff are very helpful. - Points on Hotel Shower cubicles are miniscule. Other Guests said rooms at the front were very noisy (We were at the back so it was fine, but no view !) Area a bit scruffy (But safe) General points Its about 15 mins walk to Termini Railway. But Bus stop is close at hand. Pickpockets in Rome are a menace , I caught one Guy trying to get his hand in my Wifes handbag on the Metro, so be very careful. Several excellent small Restaurants within short walk of Hotel (including a very good Veggie Restaurant.. We are not Veggies but we enjoyed a meal there, and an excellent Fish Restaurant just 100 mtrs away) Summary Not bad value for money - Close to bus stop with easy access to places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: nate&kell
Reviews.Content: 15 minute walk from the train station, with helpful signs along the way. Located in the university district with some nice local restaurants. Room was large but a little out dated. Breakfast was average. Front desk tried to get us to spend 40 euros on a taxi to the airport rather than the 2 euros for the subway and bus to get there. Would have saved us time but way more expsensive. Nothing spectacular, will give you a place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Loved it Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Laurentia for 6 days and thought it was absolutely awesome! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, helped advise us on places to eat and visit, and how to get there. It is a bit set back from the city centre, but the 71 bus just around the corner takes u straight to the city centre in about 5 minutes. The tram line is just down the road, which makes it quicker and easier to get to the colloseum. The location is only a drawback if you are planning on staying out till very late, otherwise Hotel Laurentia is the place to stay! :) The rooms are very reasonable for the price, breakfast is nice, but above all the staff are incredibly welcoming and really make the stay worthwhile! :) Next time i go to rome i will definately be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reserved a taxi with the hotel people that never showed up and had to find one on my own after 1 hour of waiting. The area around is trashy and you see more graffity there than in any bad part of New York. The room was so small that you don't have where to put your luggage. Far from any tourist sites. Bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellen hotel to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: brightonbell
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent a week at the Laurentia in June 2003 and found it absolutely charming. It is in the real Italian district near the University and the train station so there were lots of restaurants all around us and very reasonable. The staff were extremely helpful and gave us directions every day to help us get to our destination. The bus was around the corner and took us directly to the centre of Rome. The breakfasts were great and there was a lovely lounge and bar and a computer for the guests use. Our room was clean and air conditioned and very quiet. We highly recommend this hotel which was very reasonable and a real gem. We would definately stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Laurentia
HotelInfo.Address: Largo degli Osci, 63, 185 Rome, Italy
